citations.narrative:
The north side of the chain-linked perimeter fence failed to meet the minimum height requirement of six feet. This fence is
approximately 5 feet in height and has multiple holes spaced evenly along its lower edge. These holes are approximately
9”X11” in size.
Fences with openings and heights that do not meet the minimum standards may allow animals and unauthorized people
to use this section to enter and exit the area and gain access to the animals behind it.
The perimeter fence must be constructed so that it protects marine mammals by restricting animals and unauthorized
persons from going through it or under it and having contact with the marine mammals, and so that it can function as a
secondary containment system for the marine animals in the facility when appropriate.
To be corrected by October 24, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
Charles Palmer, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
3.103(c) 
   
Facilities, outdoor. 
The north side of the chain-linked perimeter fence failed to meet the minimum height requirement of six feet. This fence is 
approximately 5 feet in height and has multiple holes spaced evenly along its lower edge. These holes are approximately 
9”X11” in size.  
 
Fences with openings and heights that do not meet the minimum standards may allow animals and unauthorized people 
to use this section to enter and exit the area and gain access to the animals behind it. 
 
The perimeter fence must be constructed so that it protects marine mammals by restricting animals and unauthorized 
persons from going through it or under it and having contact with the marine mammals, and so that it can function as a 
secondary containment system for the marine animals in the facility when appropriate.  
 
To be corrected by October 24, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Charles Palmer, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
